TopicTitle: How do you used your Round-8s today?

Articles.Content:
its been pretty long since i didnt used any round-8 ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

So show here what you did with yours one

Well. I'm using it on a return craft from Duna another made a nice landing on The Mun:

![DD8B0F3BF9A9B1FEA1053C2E0CFF81347EB6CB4C](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/526141337129845453/DD8B0F3BF9A9B1FEA1053C2E0CFF81347EB6CB4C/)
cool ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif), how many dv it has?
I never use those. Squad should get rid of them. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Well, not today exactly, last week sometime, I built a cluster probe launcher that deployed 6 probes; 3 small ones with a single Round-8 and oscarB (3300 dV) and 3 larger ones with 5 Round-8s and 1 oscarB (5000 dV). Deployed in a solar orbit and then dispatched to Eve (orbited), Gilly (landed), Moho (failed), 2 to Jool (still on route), Eeloo (still on route).

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/nIX1j/embed?background=292929&text=ffffff&link=4e76c9)

I use them frequently for mun rovers if I am delivering them with a lander payload.

I also experimented with using them and ant engines to flip said rovers should they capsize, that one didn't work so well.
Is it bad that I supported the anti-removal of them but never use them?
no, because people that like em use em a lot, and you helped then

> 
> Is it bad that I supported the anti-removal of them but never use them?

Nope. You still have a choice.

> 
> Nope. You still have a choice.

I know. It was a bad joke.

For commsat clusterbombs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[![17915924901_7513c821fa_z.jpg](https://c1.staticflickr.com/9/8869/17915924901_7513c821fa_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/tiaNhV)

[![18762198166_894f75152a_z.jpg](https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/541/18762198166_894f75152a_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/uzXaRh)

[![17888960196_fcb55ae382_z.jpg](https://c2.staticflickr.com/8/7700/17888960196_fcb55ae382_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/tfMACd)

[![18509947666_b718be6621_z.jpg](https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/443/18509947666_b718be6621_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/ucEjyJ)

> 
> Is it bad that I supported the anti-removal of them but never use them?

I... I did too. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)
Well, I've made a couple of re-usable light-mun landers (Minmus, Pol, Bop, etc) based on round-8s. Haven't done much probing in 1.0 though.

> 
> I never use those. Squad should get rid of them. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

You tread on dangerous waters. Torches and pitchforks are never far away.

> 
> You tread on dangerous waters. Torches and pitchforks are never far away.

I can hear them....

> 
> I never use those. Squad should get rid of them. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

I didn't even know what they were talking about until the first pics.

I was like... "oh. Those useless tiny ring tanks that are heavier than they should be for their fuel weight compared to every other serious fuel tank in the game."

> 
> I didn't even know what they were talking about until the first pics.
> I was like... "oh. Those useless tiny ring tanks that are heavier than they should be for their fuel weight compared to every other serious fuel tank in the game."

You people are gonna start a war with all the round-8 hate (LOLOLOLOL Rhyme)

> 
> I know. It was a bad joke.

This is why I dislike communicating with writing. The authors intent is unclear.

> 
> I didn't even know what they were talking about until the first pics.
> I was like... "oh. Those useless tiny ring tanks that are heavier than they should be for their fuel weight compared to every other serious fuel tank in the game."

Oh... oh you've done it now.

You can't mistake the Round-8 for the Oscar-B without paying the price.

> 
> This is why I dislike communicating with writing. The authors intent is unclear.

Voice Chat Squad, get on it!!! (you wouldn't want to here me, I'm a pubescent voice cracker).

I don't hate them. They actually look nice as a decoration.

I just don't use them to the point that I forgot they exist. Of course, then again, I'm the guy who intentionally builds landers that weigh around 1,000 tons.

![Dwzezlw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Dwzezlw.jpg)

I've used them to make a gold foil ball for my Ariane 5G's 2nd stage.

![o50hFVW.png](http://i.imgur.com/o50hFVW.png)

> 
> You tread on dangerous waters. Torches and pitchforks are never far away.

Post-1.0 they moved from the back of the closet to the front.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I've used them to make a gold foil ball for my Ariane 5G's 2nd stage.
> [http://i.imgur.com/o50hFVW.png](http://i.imgur.com/o50hFVW.png)

Very pretty indeed.
The small parts STILL have a use. I use Spider engines on small stations as maneuvering thrusters. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

we need a monoproppelant round-8, a LF one, a xenon one (THE WORST) and an eletric charge one, and maybe a round-8 probe core?

then, we need them to take over ksp
